abstract: Judge orders Albuquerque Police Officer Dominique Perez and retired detective Keith Sandy to stand trial facing second-degree murder and manslaughter charges; men are accused of 2014 killing of James Boyd, homeless man accused of illegally camping around Sandia Mountains.
lead_paragraph: A judge ordered an Albuquerque police officer and a retired detective to stand trial for the 2014 killing of a homeless man who they had accused of illegally camping.

headline.main: New Mexico: Officers to Be Tried for Man’s Killing
headline.print_headline: New Mexico: Officers to Be Tried for Man’s Killing

snippet: A judge ordered an Albuquerque police officer and a retired detective to stand trial for the 2014 killing of a homeless man who they had accused of illegally camping.
